013package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.IOUtils.*;
016
017import java.io.*;
018import java.time.*;
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.stream.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
024
025/**
026 * Main class for creation of assertions for stand-alone testing.
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * Provides assertions for various common POJO types.
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
032 * <p class='bjava'>
033 *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
034 *
035 * <jc>// Assert string is greater than 100 characters and contains "foo".</jc>
036 *    <jsm>assertString</jsm>(<jv>myString</jv>)
037 *       .length().isGt(100)
038 *       .contains(<js>"foo"</js>);
039 * </p>
040 *
041 * <p>
042 * Provides simple testing that {@link Throwable Throwables} are being thrown correctly.
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
045 * <p class='bjava'>
046 *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
047 *
048 * <jc>// Assert that calling doBadCall() causes a RuntimeException.</jc>
049 *    <jsm>assertThrown</jsm>(() -&gt; <jv>myPojo</jv>.doBadCall())
050 *       .isType(RuntimeException.<jk>class</jk>)
051 *       .message().contains(<js>"Bad thing happened."</js>);
052 * </p>
053 *
054 * <p>
055 * Provides other assertion convenience methods such as asserting non-null method arguments.
056 *
057 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
058 * <p class='bjava'>
059 *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
060 *
061 * <jk>public</jk> String getFoo(String <jv>bar</jv>) {
062 *    <jsm>assertArgNotNull</jsm>(<js>"bar"</js>, <jv>bar</jv>);
063 *    ...
064 * }
065 * </p>
066 *
067 * <ul class='seealso'>
068 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a>
069 * </ul>
070 */
071public class Assertions {
072
073   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
074   // Fluent assertions
075   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
076
077   /**
078    * Performs an assertion on an arbitrary POJO.
079    *
080    * <p>
081    * The distinction between {@link ObjectAssertion} and {@link AnyAssertion} is that the latter supports all
082    * the operations of the former, but adds various transform methods for conversion to specific assertion types.
083    *
084    * <p>
085    * Various transform methods such as {@link FluentListAssertion#asItem(int)} and {@link FluentBeanAssertion#asProperty(String)}
086    * return generic any-assertions so that they can be easily transformed into other assertion types.
087    *
088    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
089    * <p class='bjava'>
090    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
091    *
092    *    <jc>// Asserts that the property 'foo' of a bean is 'bar'.</jc>
093    *    <jsm>assertAny</jsm>(<jv>myPojo</jv>)  <jc>// Start with AnyAssertion.</jc>
094    *       .asBean(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>)  <jc>// Transform to BeanAssertion.</jc>
095    *          .property(<js>"foo"</js>).is(<js>"bar"</js>);
096    * </p>
097    *
098    * <p>
099    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link AnyAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
100    *
101    * @param <T> The value type.
102    * @param value
103    *    The object being tested.
104    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
105    * @return
106    *    A new assertion object.
107    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
108    */
109   public static final <T> AnyAssertion<T> assertAny(T value) {
110      return AnyAssertion.create(value);
111   }
112
113   /**
114    * Performs an assertion on an array of POJOs.
115    *
116    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
117    * <p class='bjava'>
118    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
119    *
120    * <jc>// Asserts that an Integer array contains [1,2,3].</jc>
121    *    Integer[] <jv>array</jv> = {...};
122    *    <jsm>assertArray</jsm>(<jv>array</jv>)
123    *       .asJson().is(<js>"[1,2,3]"</js>);
124    * </p>
125    *
126    * <p>
127    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
128    *
129    * @param <E> The value element type.
130    * @param value
131    *    The object being tested.
132    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
133    * @return
134    *    A new assertion object.
135    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
136    */
137   public static final <E> ArrayAssertion<E> assertArray(E[] value) {
138      return ArrayAssertion.create(value);
139   }
140
141   /**
142    * Performs an assertion on a Java bean.
143    *
144    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
145    * <p class='bjava'>
146    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
147    *
148    * <jc>// Asserts that the 'foo' and 'bar' properties of a bean are 1 and 2 respectively.</jc>
149    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>)
150    *       .isType(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>)
151    *       .extract(<js>"foo,bar"</js>)
152    *          .asJson().is(<js>"{foo:1,bar:2}"</js>);
153    * </p>
154    *
155    * <p>
156    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link BeanAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
157    *
158    * @param <T> The value type.
159    * @param value
160    *    The object being tested.
161    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
162    * @return
163    *    A new assertion object.
164    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
165    */
166   public static final <T> BeanAssertion<T> assertBean(T value) {
167      return BeanAssertion.create(value);
168   }
169
170   /**
171    * Performs an assertion on a list of Java beans.
172    *
173    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
174    * <p class='bjava'>
175    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
176    *
177    * <jc>// Asserts that a bean list has 3 entries with 'foo' property values of 'bar','baz','qux'.</jc>
178    *    <jsm>assertBeanList</jsm>(<jv>myListOfBeans</jv>)
179    *       .isSize(3)
180    *       .property(<js>"foo"</js>)
181    *          .is(<js>"bar"</js>,<js>"baz"</js>,<js>"qux"</js>);
182    * </p>
183    *
184    * <p>
185    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link BeanListAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
186    *
187    * @param <E> The element type.
188    * @param value
189    *    The object being tested.
190    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
191    * @return
192    *    A new assertion object.
193    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
194    */
195   public static final <E> BeanListAssertion<E> assertBeanList(List<E> value) {
196      return BeanListAssertion.create(value);
197   }
198
199   /**
200    * Performs an assertion on a Boolean.
201    *
202    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
203    * <p class='bjava'>
204    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
205    *
206    * <jc>// Asserts that a Boolean is not null and TRUE.</jc>
207    *    <jsm>assertBoolean</jsm>(<jv>myBoolean</jv>)
208    *       .isTrue();
209    * </p>
210    *
211    * <p>
212    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link BooleanAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
213    *
214    * @param value
215    *    The object being tested.
216    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
217    * @return
218    *    A new assertion object.
219    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
220    */
221   public static final BooleanAssertion assertBoolean(Boolean value) {
222      return BooleanAssertion.create(value);
223   }
224
225   /**
226    * Performs an assertion on a boolean array.
227    *
228    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
229    * <p class='bjava'>
230    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
231    *
232    * <jc>// Asserts that a Boolean array has size of 3 and all entries are TRUE.</jc>
233    *    <jsm>assertBooleanArray</jsm>(<jv>myBooleanArray</jv>)
234    *       .isSize(3)
235    *       .all(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv> == <jk>true</jk>);
236    * </p>
237    *
238    * <p>
239    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link PrimitiveArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
240    *
241    * @param value
242    *    The object being tested.
243    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
244    * @return
245    *    A new assertion object.
246    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
247    */
248   public static final PrimitiveArrayAssertion<Boolean,boolean[]> assertBooleanArray(boolean[] value) {
249      return PrimitiveArrayAssertion.create(value);
250   }
251
252   /**
253    * Performs an assertion on a byte array.
254    *
255    * <p>
256    * The distinction between {@link #assertByteArray} and {@link #assertBytes} is that the former returns an assertion
257    * more tied to general byte arrays and the latter returns an assertion more tied to dealing with binary streams
258    * that can be decoded or transformed into a string.
259    *
260    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
261    * <p class='bjava'>
262    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
263    *
264    * <jc>// Asserts that a byte array has size of 3 and all bytes are larger than 10.</jc>
265    *    <jsm>assertByteArray</jsm>(<jv>myByteArray</jv>)
266    *       .isSize(3)
267    *       .all(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv> &gt; 10);
268    * </p>
269    *
270    * <p>
271    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link PrimitiveArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
272    *
273    * @param value
274    *    The object being tested.
275    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
276    * @return
277    *    A new assertion object.
278    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
279    */
280   public static final PrimitiveArrayAssertion<Byte,byte[]> assertByteArray(byte[] value) {
281      return PrimitiveArrayAssertion.create(value);
282   }
283
284   /**
285    * Performs an assertion on a byte array.
286    *
287    * <p>
288    * The distinction between {@link #assertByteArray} and {@link #assertBytes} is that the former returns an assertion
289    * more tied to general byte arrays and the latter returns an assertion more tied to dealing with binary streams
290    * that can be decoded or transformed into a string.
291    *
292    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
293    * <p class='bjava'>
294    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
295    *
296    *    <jc>// Asserts that the byte array contains the string "foo".</jc>
297    *    <jsm>assertBytes</jsm>(<jv>myBytes</jv>)
298    *       .asHex().is(<js>"666F6F"</js>);
299    * </p>
300    *
301    * <p>
302    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ByteArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
303    *
304    * @param value
305    *    The object being tested.
306    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
307    * @return
308    *    A new assertion object.
309    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
310    */
311   public static final ByteArrayAssertion assertBytes(byte[] value) {
312      return ByteArrayAssertion.create(value);
313   }
314
315   /**
316    * Performs an assertion on the contents of an input stream.
317    *
318    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
319    * <p class='bjava'>
320    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
321    *
322    *    <jc>// Asserts that the stream contains the string "foo".</jc>
323    *    <jsm>assertBytes</jsm>(<jv>myStream</jv>)
324    *       .asHex().is(<js>"666F6F"</js>);
325    * </p>
326    *
327    * <p>
328    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ByteArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
329    *
330    * @param value
331    *    The object being tested.
332    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
333    *    <br>Stream is automatically closed.
334    * @return
335    *    A new assertion object.
336    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
337    * @throws IOException If thrown while reading contents from stream.
338    */
339   public static final ByteArrayAssertion assertBytes(InputStream value) throws IOException {
340      return assertBytes(value == null ? null : readBytes(value));
341   }
342
343   /**
344    * Performs an assertion on a char array.
345    *
346    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
347    * <p class='bjava'>
348    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
349    *
350    *    <jc>// Asserts that the char array contains the string "foo".</jc>
351    *    <jsm>assertCharArray</jsm>(<jv>myCharArray</jv>)
352    *       .asString().is(<js>"foo"</js>);
353    * </p>
354    *
355    * <p>
356    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link PrimitiveArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
357    *
358    * @param value
359    *    The object being tested.
360    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
361    * @return
362    *    A new assertion object.
363    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
364    */
365   public static final PrimitiveArrayAssertion<Character,char[]> assertCharArray(char[] value) {
366      return PrimitiveArrayAssertion.create(value);
367   }
368
369   /**
370    * Performs an assertion on a collection of POJOs.
371    *
372    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
373    * <p class='bjava'>
374    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
375    *
376    *    <jc>// Asserts that a collection of strings has only one entry of 'foo'.</jc>
377    *    <jsm>assertCollection</jsm>(<jv>myCollectionOfStrings</jv>)
378    *       .isSize(1)
379    *       .contains(<js>"foo"</js>);
380    * </p>
381    *
382    * <p>
383    * In general, use {@link #assertList(List)} if you're performing an assertion on a list since {@link ListAssertion}
384    * provides more functionality than {@link CollectionAssertion}.
385    *
386    * <p>
387    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link CollectionAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
388    *
389    * @param <E> The element type.
390    * @param value
391    *    The object being tested.
392    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
393    * @return
394    *    A new assertion object.
395    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
396    */
397   public static final <E> CollectionAssertion<E> assertCollection(Collection<E> value) {
398      return CollectionAssertion.create(value);
399   }
400
401   /**
402    * Performs an assertion on a Comparable.
403    *
404    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
405    * <p class='bjava'>
406    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
407    *
408    *    <jc>// Asserts a comparable is less than another comparable.</jc>
409    *    <jsm>assertComparable</jsm>(<jv>myComparable</jv>)
410    *       .isLt(<jv>anotherComparable</jv>);
411    * </p>
412    *
413    * <p>
414    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ComparableAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
415    *
416    * @param <T> The value type.
417    * @param value
418    *    The object being tested.
419    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
420    * @return
421    *    A new assertion object.
422    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
423    */
424   public static final <T extends Comparable<T>> ComparableAssertion<T> assertComparable(T value) {
425      return ComparableAssertion.create(value);
426   }
427
428   /**
429    * Performs an assertion on a Date.
430    *
431    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
432    * <p class='bjava'>
433    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
434    *
435    *    <jc>// Asserts the specified date is after the current date.</jc>
436    *    <jsm>assertDate</jsm>(<jv>myDate</jv>)
437    *       .isAfterNow();
438    * </p>
439    *
440    * <p>
441    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link DateAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
442    *
443    * @param value
444    *    The object being tested.
445    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
446    * @return
447    *    A new assertion object.
448    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
449    */
450   public static final DateAssertion assertDate(Date value) {
451      return DateAssertion.create(value);
452   }
453
454   /**
455    * Performs an assertion on a double array.
456    *
457    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
458    * <p class='bjava'>
459    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
460    *
461    *    <jc>// Asserts that a double array is at least size 100 and all values are greater than 1000.</jc>
462    *    <jsm>assertDoubleArray</jsm>(<jv>myDoubleArray</jv>)
463    *       .size().isGte(100f)
464    *       .all(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv> &gt; 1000f);
465    * </p>
466    *
467    * <p>
468    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link PrimitiveArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
469    *
470    * @param value
471    *    The object being tested.
472    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
473    * @return
474    *    A new assertion object.
475    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
476    */
477   public static final PrimitiveArrayAssertion<Double,double[]> assertDoubleArray(double[] value) {
478      return PrimitiveArrayAssertion.create(value);
479   }
480
481   /**
482    * Performs an assertion on a float array.
483    *
484    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
485    * <p class='bjava'>
486    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
487    *
488    *    <jc>// Asserts that a float array is at least size 100 and all values are greater than 1000.</jc>
489    *    <jsm>assertFloatArray</jsm>(<jv>myFloatArray</jv>)
490    *       .size().isGte(100f)
491    *       .all(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv> &gt; 1000f);
492    * </p>
493    *
494    * <p>
495    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link PrimitiveArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
496    *
497    * @param value
498    *    The object being tested.
499    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
500    * @return
501    *    A new assertion object.
502    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
503    */
504   public static final PrimitiveArrayAssertion<Float,float[]> assertFloatArray(float[] value) {
505      return PrimitiveArrayAssertion.create(value);
506   }
507
508   /**
509    * Performs an assertion on an int array.
510    *
511    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
512    * <p class='bjava'>
513    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
514    *
515    *    <jc>// Asserts that a double array is at least size 100 and all values are greater than 1000.</jc>
516    *    <jsm>assertIntArray</jsm>(<jv>myIntArray</jv>)
517    *       .size().isGte(100)
518    *       .all(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv> &gt; 1000);
519    * </p>
520    *
521    * <p>
522    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link PrimitiveArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
523    *
524    * @param value
525    *    The object being tested.
526    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
527    * @return
528    *    A new assertion object.
529    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
530    */
531   public static final PrimitiveArrayAssertion<Integer,int[]> assertIntArray(int[] value) {
532      return PrimitiveArrayAssertion.create(value);
533   }
534
535   /**
536    * Performs an assertion on an Integer.
537    *
538    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
539    * <p class='bjava'>
540    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
541    *
542    *    <jc>// Assert that an HTTP response status code is 200 or 404.</jc>
543    *    <jsm>assertInteger</jsm>(<jv>httpReponse</jv>)
544    *       .isAny(200,404);
545    * </p>
546    *
547    * <p>
548    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link IntegerAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
549    *
550    * @param value
551    *    The object being tested.
552    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
553    * @return
554    *    A new assertion object.
555    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
556    */
557   public static final IntegerAssertion assertInteger(Integer value) {
558      return IntegerAssertion.create(value);
559   }
560
561   /**
562    * Performs an assertion on a list of POJOs.
563    *
564    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
565    * <p class='bjava'>
566    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
567    *
568    *    <jc>// Assert that the first entry in a list is "{foo:'bar'}" when serialized to simplified JSON.</jc>
569    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(<jv>myList</jv>)
570    *       .item(0)
571    *          .asJson().is(<js>"{foo:'bar'}"</js>);
572    * </p>
573    *
574    * <p>
575    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ListAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
576    *
577    * @param <E> The element type.
578    * @param value
579    *    The object being tested.
580    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
581    * @return
582    *    A new assertion object.
583    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
584    */
585   public static final <E> ListAssertion<E> assertList(List<E> value) {
586      return ListAssertion.create(value);
587   }
588
589   /**
590    * Performs an assertion on a stream of POJOs.
591    *
592    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
593    * <p class='bjava'>
594    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
595    *
596    *    <jc>// Assert that the first entry in a list is "{foo:'bar'}" when serialized to simplified JSON.</jc>
597    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(<jv>myStream</jv>)
598    *       .item(0)
599    *          .asJson().is(<js>"{foo:'bar'}"</js>);
600    * </p>
601    *
602    * <p>
603    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ListAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
604    *
605    * @param <E> The element type.
606    * @param value
607    *    The object being tested.
608    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
609    * @return
610    *    A new assertion object.
611    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
612    */
613   public static final <E> ListAssertion<E> assertList(Stream<E> value) {
614      return ListAssertion.create(value);
615   }
616
617   /**
618    * Performs an assertion on a Long.
619    *
620    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
621    * <p class='bjava'>
622    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
623    *
624    *    <jc>// Throw a BadReqest if an HTTP response length is greater than 100k.</jc>
625    *    <jsm>assertLong</jsm>(<jv>responseLength</jv>)
626    *       .throwable(BadRequest.<jk>class</jk>)
627    *       .msg(<js>"Request is too large"</js>)
628    *       .isLt(100000);
629    * </p>
630    *
631    * <p>
632    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link LongAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
633    *
634    * @param value
635    *    The object being tested.
636    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
637    * @return
638    *    A new assertion object.
639    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
640    */
641   public static final LongAssertion assertLong(Long value) {
642      return LongAssertion.create(value);
643   }

645   /**
646    * Performs an assertion on a long array.
647    *
648    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
649    * <p class='bjava'>
650    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
651    *
652    *    <jc>// Asserts that a long array is at least size 100 and all values are greater than 1000.</jc>
653    *    <jsm>assertLongArray</jsm>(<jv>myLongArray</jv>)
654    *       .size().isGte(100)
655    *       .all(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv> &gt; 1000);
656    * </p>
657    *
658    * <p>
659    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link PrimitiveArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
660    *
661    * @param value
662    *    The object being tested.
663    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
664    * @return
665    *    A new assertion object.
666    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
667    */
668   public static final PrimitiveArrayAssertion<Long,long[]> assertLongArray(long[] value) {
669      return PrimitiveArrayAssertion.create(value);
670   }
671
672   /**
673    * Performs an assertion on a map.
674    *
675    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
676    * <p class='bjava'>
677    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
678    *
679    *    <jc>// Assert the specified map is a HashMap and contains the key "foo".</jc>
680    *    <jsm>assertMap</jsm>(<jv>myMap</jv>)
681    *       .isType(HashMap.<jk>class</jk>)
682    *       .containsKey(<js>"foo"</js>);
683    * </p>
684    *
685    * <p>
686    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link MapAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
687    *
688    * @param <K> The key type.
689    * @param <V> The value type.
690    * @param value
691    *    The object being tested.
692    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
693    * @return
694    *    A new assertion object.
695    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
696    */
697   public static final <K,V> MapAssertion<K,V> assertMap(Map<K,V> value) {
698      return MapAssertion.create(value);
699   }

701   /**
702    * Performs an assertion on a Java Object.
703    *
704    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
705    * <p class='bjava'>
706    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
707    *
708    *    <jc>// Asserts the specified POJO is of type MyBean and is "{foo:'bar'}" </jc>
709    *    <jc>// when serialized to Simplified JSON.</jc>
710    *    <jsm>assertObject</jsm>(<jv>myPojo</jv>)
711    *       .isType(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>)
712    *       .asJson().is(<js>"{foo:'bar'}"</js>);
713    * </p>
714    *
715    * <p>
716    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ObjectAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
717    *
718    * @param <T> The value type.
719    * @param value
720    *    The object being tested.
721    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
722    * @return
723    *    A new assertion object.
724    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
725    */
726   public static final <T> ObjectAssertion<T> assertObject(T value) {
727      return ObjectAssertion.create(value);
728   }
729
730   /**
731    * Performs an assertion on a Java Object wrapped in an Optional.
732    *
733    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
734    * <p class='bjava'>
735    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
736    *
737    *    <jc>// Asserts the specified POJO is of type MyBean and is "{foo:'bar'}" </jc>
738    *    <jc>// when serialized to Simplified JSON.</jc>
739    *    <jsm>assertOptional</jsm>(<jv>opt</jv>)
740    *       .isType(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>)
741    *       .asJson().is(<js>"{foo:'bar'}"</js>);
742    * </p>
743    *
744    * <p>
745    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link AnyAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
746    *
747    * @param <T> The value type.
748    * @param value
749    *    The object being tested.
750    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
751    * @return
752    *    A new assertion object.
753    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
754    */
755   public static final <T> AnyAssertion<T> assertOptional(Optional<T> value) {
756      return AnyAssertion.create(value.orElse(null));
757   }
758
759   /**
760    * Performs an assertion on the contents of a Reader.
761    *
762    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
763    * <p class='bjava'>
764    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
765    *
766    *    <jc>// Asserts the contents of the Reader contains "foo".</jc>
767    *    <jsm>assertReader</jsm>(<jv>myReader</jv>)
768    *       .contains(<js>"foo"</js>);
769    * </p>
770    *
771    * <p>
772    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link StringAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
773    *
774    * @param value
775    *    The object being tested.
776    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
777    *    <br>Reader is automatically closed.
778    * @return
779    *    A new assertion object.
780    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
781    * @throws IOException If thrown while reading contents from reader.
782    */
783   public static final StringAssertion assertReader(Reader value) throws IOException {
784      return assertString(read(value));
785   }
786
787   /**
788    * Performs an assertion on a short array.
789    *
790    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
791    * <p class='bjava'>
792    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
793    *
794    *    <jc>// Asserts that a float array is at least size 10 and all values are greater than 100.</jc>
795    *    <jsm>assertShortArray</jsm>(<jv>myShortArray</jv>)
796    *       .size().isGte(10)
797    *       .all(<jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv> &gt; 100);
798    * </p>
799    *
800    * <p>
801    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link PrimitiveArrayAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
802    *
803    * @param value
804    *    The object being tested.
805    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
806    * @return
807    *    A new assertion object.
808    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
809    */
810   public static final PrimitiveArrayAssertion<Short,short[]> assertShortArray(short[] value) {
811      return PrimitiveArrayAssertion.create(value);
812   }
813
814   /**
815    * Performs an assertion on a String.
816    *
817    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
818    * <p class='bjava'>
819    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
820    *
821    * <jc>// Asserts a string is at least 100 characters long and contains "foo".</jc>
822    *    <jsm>assertString</jsm>(<jv>myString</jv>)
823    *       .size().isGte(100)
824    *       .contains(<js>"foo"</js>);
825    * </p>
826    *
827    * <p>
828    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link StringAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
829    *
830    * @param value
831    *    The object being tested.
832    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
833    * @return
834    *    A new assertion object.
835    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
836    */
837   public static final StringAssertion assertString(Object value) {
838      if (value instanceof Optional)
839         value = ((Optional<?>)value).orElse(null);
840      return StringAssertion.create(value);
841   }
842
843   /**
844    * Performs an assertion on a list of Strings.
845    *
846    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
847    * <p class='bjava'>
848    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
849    *
850    * <jc>// Asserts a list of strings contain "foo,bar,baz" after trimming all and joining.</jc>
851    *    <jsm>assertStringList</jsm>(<jv>myListOfStrings</jv>)
852    *       .isSize(3)
853    *       .trim()
854    *       .join(<js>","</js>)
855    *       .is(<js>"foo,bar,baz"</js>);
856    * </p>
857    *
858    * <p>
859    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link StringListAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
860    *
861    * @param value
862    *    The object being tested.
863    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
864    * @return
865    *    A new assertion object.
866    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
867    */
868   public static final StringListAssertion assertStringList(List<String> value) {
869      return StringListAssertion.create(value);
870   }
871
872   /**
873    * Performs an assertion on a Throwable.
874    *
875    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
876    * <p class='bjava'>
877    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
878    *
879    *    <jc>// Asserts a throwable is a RuntimeException containing 'foobar' in the message.</jc>
880    *    <jsm>assertThrowable</jsm>(<jv>throwable</jv>)
881    *       .isExactType(RuntimeException.<jk>class</jk>)
882    *       .message().contains(<js>"foobar"</js>);
883    * </p>
884    *
885    * <p>
886    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ThrowableAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
887    *
888    * @param <T> The value type.
889    * @param value
890    *    The object being tested.
891    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
892    * @return
893    *    A new assertion object.
894    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
895    */
896   public static final <T extends Throwable> ThrowableAssertion<T> assertThrowable(T value) {
897      return ThrowableAssertion.create(value);
898   }

900   /**
901    * Performs an assertion on a Version.
902    *
903    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
904    * <p class='bjava'>
905    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
906    *
907    *    <jc>// Asserts the specified major version is at least 2.</jc>
908    *    <jsm>assertVersion</jsm>(<jv>version</jv>)
909    *       .major().isGte(2);
910    * </p>
911    *
912    * <p>
913    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link VersionAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
914    *
915    * @param value
916    *    The object being tested.
917    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
918    * @return
919    *    A new assertion object.
920    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
921    */
922   public static final VersionAssertion assertVersion(Version value) {
923      return VersionAssertion.create(value);
924   }
925
926   /**
927    * Performs an assertion on a ZonedDateTime.
928    *
929    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
930    * <p class='bjava'>
931    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
932    *
933    *    <jc>// Asserts the specified date is after the current date.</jc>
934    *    <jsm>assertZonedDateTime</jsm>(<jv>myZonedDateTime</jv>)
935    *       .isAfterNow();
936    * </p>
937    *
938    * <p>
939    * See <a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-assertions.ja.Overview">Fluent Assertions</a> for general assertion usage and {@link ZonedDateTimeAssertion} for supported operations on this type.
940    *
941    * @param value
942    *    The object being tested.
943    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
944    * @return
945    *    A new assertion object.
946    *    <br>Never <jk>null</jk>.
947    */
948   public static final ZonedDateTimeAssertion assertZonedDateTime(ZonedDateTime value) {
949      return ZonedDateTimeAssertion.create(value);
950   }
951
952   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
953   // Snippet assertions
954   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
955
956   /**
957    * Executes an arbitrary snippet of code and captures anything thrown from it as a Throwable assertion.
958    *
959    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
960    * <p class='bjava'>
961    *    <jk>import static</jk> org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertions.*;
962    *
963    *    <jc>// Asserts that the specified method throws a RuntimeException containing "foobar" in the message. </jc>
964    *    <jsm>assertThrown</jsm>(()-&gt;<jv>foo</jv>.getBar())
965    *       .isType(RuntimeException.<jk>class</jk>)
966    *       .message().contains(<js>"foobar"</js>);
967    * </p>
968    *
969    * @param snippet The snippet of code to execute.
970    * @return A new assertion object.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
971    */
972   public static final ThrowableAssertion<Throwable> assertThrown(Snippet snippet) {
973      try {
974         snippet.run();
975      } catch (Throwable e) {
976         return assertThrowable(e);
977      }
978      return assertThrowable(null);
979   }
980}
